TEST.0.title: North Carolina Division C State Test 23 April 2022

CIPHER.403.cipherString: But man has still another powerful resource: natural science with its strictly objective methods.
CIPHER.403.question: Solve this quote from Ivan Pavlov which has been encoded as an Aristocrat

CIPHER.404.cipherString: All art is but dirtying the paper delicately.
CIPHER.404.question: A quote by John Ruskin has been encoded using the Pollux Cipher for you to decode. You are told that 7=–, 5=×, 1=×, 9=●, 3=×, 4=–

CIPHER.405.question: Decode this quote by Alexander Pope which has been encoded with a HILL 2x2 Cipher using a keyword of BLUR

CIPHER.406.cipherString: Here's to freedom, cheers to art. Here's to having an excellent adventure and may the stopping never start.
CIPHER.406.question: Solve this Aristocrat of a quote by Jason Mraz which has been encoded using a K2 alphabet.

CIPHER.368.cipherString: La mayoría de las personas pueden aprender mucho más de lo que piensan. Se creen incapaces sin intentarlo
CIPHER.368.question: Solve this Xenocrypt which is a quote by Elon Musk translated into Spanish and encoded using a K1 alphabet using an English keyword.
CIPHER.368.translation: Most people can learn a lot more than they think. They think they are incapable without trying.

CIPHER.407.cipherString: The autonomy of life is known throughout the universe.
CIPHER.407.question: The following symbols are a Baconian cipher of a quote by Anthony T. Hincks.  What did they say?

CIPHER.408.cipherString: Too often, people get stuck in a state of over-thinking, the result is that they never reach a decision.
CIPHER.408.question: A quote by Steve Backley has been encoded as an Aristocrat using a K1 alphabet.  What does it decode to?

CIPHER.409.cipherString: Possibility of life on any planet needs availability of air, water, sun-rays and vegetation.  Not money and property.
CIPHER.409.question: Decode this quote by Rajesh Walecha which has been encoded as a Caesar Cipher.

CIPHER.410.cipherString: What we see depends mainly on what we look for.
CIPHER.410.question: A quote from Sir John Lubbock has been encoded using the Pollux Cipher for you to decode. You are told that 0=–, 9=–, 8=●, 7=×, 6=–, 5=×

CIPHER.411.cipherString: Do not give up on yourself. Leave that for the other people.
CIPHER.411.question: The following strange headlines encode a quote by Anthony T. Hincks using a Baconian cipher. You are told that the deciphered text starts with DONOT

CIPHER.412.cipherString: How grief and the passage of years can leave their mark. How the burden of duty can wear away the body's resilience
CIPHER.412.question: Solve this Aristocrat which is a quote by Anne O'Brien encoded using a K1 alphabet

CIPHER.413.cipherString: Problems in science are sometimes made easier by adding complications.
CIPHER.413.question: Solve this Daniel C. Dennett which has been encoded with a RailFence cipher using 5 rails.

CIPHER.414.cipherString: Do you think there are smartphones in the afterlife? Because if not, lots of people are going to be very miserable there.
CIPHER.414.question: Solve this quote by Todd Perelmuter which has been encoded as a Patristocrat using a K1 alphabet

CIPHER.415.cipherString: Some say life is the thing, but I prefer reading.
CIPHER.415.question: A quote by Ruth Rendell has been encoded using the Morbit Cipher for you to decode. You are told that 1=●×, 2=●–, 3=××, 4=–×, 5=–●, 6=×●

CIPHER.371.cipherString: El mejor trabajo en equipo proviene de las personas que trabajan independientemente hacia una misma meta y al unísono
CIPHER.371.question: Solve this Xenocrypt which is a quote by James Cash Penney which has been translated into Spanish and encoded using a K1 alphabet with an English keyword
CIPHER.371.translation: The best teamwork comes from people working independently toward the same goal and in unison.

CIPHER.416.question: Decode this quote by Walt Whitman which has been encode using a Hill cipher with a keyword of REPUTABLE

CIPHER.417.cipherString: A polar bear is a rectangular bear after a coordinate transform.
CIPHER.417.question: The following quote has been encoded with the Porta Cipher using a very common word for the key. The deciphered text ends with FORM.

CIPHER.418.cipherString: How do you tell the psychiatrists from the patients in the hospital? The patients get better and leave.
CIPHER.418.question: A quote by Lisa Scottoline has been encoded with a K2 alphabet using a key phrase.  What was the key phrase used to encode it?

CIPHER.419.cipherString: I wonder if you can refuse to inherit the world.
CIPHER.419.question: A quote from Bill Watterson has been encoded using the Morbit Cipher for you to decode. You are told that 2=●×, 4=––, 6=×●, 8=×–, 1=●–

CIPHER.420.cipherString: If obstacles are large, jump higher.
CIPHER.420.question: The following quote by Steve Backley has been encoded using the Affine Cipher. You are told that the deciphered text starts with IF

CIPHER.421.cipherString: Trees make me beleve taht wee can also renew and reshape hour lives, know madder wat wee face inn lyfe
CIPHER.421.question: Your friend has given you a quote by Ahmed Omaar as an Aristocrat encoded using a K1 alphabet.  Unfortunately for you, they are a really bad speller.  What does it decode to?

CIPHER.422.cipherString: I find that a little bit of crazy is an essential ingredient of discovery.
CIPHER.422.question: Solve this quote by Steven Magee which has been encoded using a RailFence cipher with either 2, 3 or 4 rails.

CIPHER.423.cipherString: Scientific revolutions, almost by definition, defy common sense.
CIPHER.423.question: The following quote by Michio Kaku needs to be decoded with the Porta Cipher with a keyword of SHOCK

CIPHER.424.question: Decode this quote by Dan Brown which has been encoded using a Hill cipher with a keyword of POET

CIPHER.425.cipherString: The biggest challenge after success is shutting up about it.
CIPHER.425.question: The following quote from Criss Jami needs to be decoded with the Vigenère Cipher with a keyword of CENSOR

CIPHER.426.cipherString: There is more to life than simply increasing its speed.
CIPHER.426.question: A quote by Mahatma Gandhi has been encoded as a Baconian Cipher.  What did they say?

CIPHER.427.cipherString: What a waste my life would be without all the beautiful mistakes I've made.
CIPHER.427.question: Solve this quote by Alice Bag which has been encoded as a Railfence cipher using either 3 or 4 rails.  The world MADE appears in it once.

CIPHER.428.cipherString: I feel an almost overwhelming interest in the methods of daylight abduction employed by the modern youth.
CIPHER.428.question: A quote by Georgette Heyer has been encoded using a K3 alphabet with a key phrase.  What is the Key Phrase used to encode it?

CIPHER.429.cipherString: Travel far enough, you meet yourself.
CIPHER.429.question: The following quote by David Mitchell needs to be decoded with the Affine Cipher where a=9 and b=8.

CIPHER.430.cipherString: The first civilized being is not the one who wore a suit, but the one who stood up and said, I'll correct myself.
CIPHER.430.question: Solve this quote by Abhijit Naskar which has been encoded as an Aristocrat.

CIPHER.431.cipherString: A mathematician is a device for turning coffee into theorems.
CIPHER.431.question: The following quote from Alfred Renyi has been encoded with the Vigenère Cipher using a very common word for the key. The deciphered text starts with AMAT.
